name: sentiment_positive
input: This product exceeded my expectations. Absolutely love it!
expected_output: positive

name: sentiment_negative
input: Terrible experience. The product broke after one day.
expected_output: negative

name: sentiment_mixed
input: Great features but the price is way too high for what you get.
expected_output: mixed

name: ticket_billing
input: I was charged twice for my subscription this month. Please refund.
expected_output: billing

name: ticket_technical
input: The app crashes every time I try to upload a file larger than 10MB.
expected_output: technical

name: contact_full
input: Reach out to Sarah Johnson at sarah.j@company.com or call 415-555-0199.
expected_output: {"name": "Sarah Johnson", "email": "sarah.j@company.com", "phone": "415-555-0199"}

name: address_extraction
input: Ship to: 123 Main Street, Suite 400, San Francisco, CA 94105
expected_output: {"street": "123 Main Street, Suite 400", "city": "San Francisco", "state": "CA", "zip": "94105"}

name: price_extraction
input: The base plan starts at $29/month, pro plan is $79/month, enterprise is custom pricing.
expected_output: {"base": 29, "pro": 79, "enterprise": "custom"}

name: date_multi
input: Project kicks off Jan 15 2026, milestone review on Feb 28, final delivery by March 31.

name: skill_extraction
input: Looking for a developer with Python, React, PostgreSQL, and Docker experience.
expected_output: ["Python", "React", "PostgreSQL", "Docker"]

name: cold_email
input: Write a cold outreach email to a SaaS company about our AI consulting services.
expected_output: Subject: Boost Your SaaS with AI-Powered Automation...

name: product_description
input: Write a product description for a noise-canceling wireless headphone under $100.
expected_output: Experience studio-quality sound without the studio price...

name: meeting_agenda
input: Create a meeting agenda for a Q1 planning session with the engineering team.
expected_output: Q1 Engineering Planning Meeting Agenda...

name: social_post
input: Write a LinkedIn post announcing our Series A funding of $10M.
expected_output: Thrilled to announce our $10M Series A...

name: earnings_summary
input: Summarize: Q4 revenue $2.3B (+12% YoY), operating margin 28%, new subscriber growth 15%, guidance raised for FY2026.
expected_output: Strong Q4 with $2.3B revenue (12% growth), healthy 28% margins, 15% subscriber growth, and raised full-year guidance.
context: Q4 earnings report with revenue $2.3B up 12% year over year. Operating margin at 28%. New subscriber growth of 15%. Company raised guidance for fiscal year 2026.

name: research_abstract
input: Summarize this ML paper abstract about transformer attention mechanisms and their computational complexity.
expected_output: The paper proposes a linear attention mechanism reducing transformer complexity from O(n^2) to O(n).
context: We propose a novel linear attention mechanism that reduces the computational complexity of standard transformer attention from quadratic to linear in sequence length.

name: legal_summary
input: Summarize the key terms of this SaaS agreement.
expected_output: 12-month term, auto-renewal, 30-day cancellation notice, 99.9% SLA, data processing per GDPR.
context: Agreement term is 12 months with automatic renewal. Either party may cancel with 30 days written notice. Service level agreement guarantees 99.9% uptime. Data processing compliant with GDPR.

name: hr_policy
input: How many vacation days do new employees get?
expected_output: New employees receive 15 vacation days per year, increasing to 20 after 3 years.
context: Vacation Policy: New employees receive 15 vacation days annually. After 3 years of service, this increases to 20 days. After 7 years, employees receive 25 days.

name: product_faq
input: Does the premium plan include API access?
expected_output: Yes, the premium plan includes full API access with a rate limit of 1000 requests per minute.
context: Plan Features: Basic - no API access. Premium - full API access, 1000 req/min. Enterprise - unlimited API access with dedicated endpoints.

name: shipping_info
input: How long does international shipping take?
expected_output: International shipping takes 7-14 business days depending on destination.
context: Shipping: Domestic orders ship within 2-3 business days. International orders take 7-14 business days. Express international available for 3-5 business days at additional cost.

name: warranty_question
input: What does the warranty cover?
expected_output: The warranty covers manufacturing defects for 2 years from purchase date.
context: Warranty: All products carry a 2-year warranty from date of purchase covering manufacturing defects. Physical damage and normal wear are not covered. Extended warranty available for purchase.

name: churn_analysis
input: Analyze factors contributing to customer churn in our Q4 data.
expected_output: Key churn drivers: pricing sensitivity (35%), feature gaps (25%), support quality (20%), competitor switching (20%).

name: cost_optimization
input: Analyze our cloud infrastructure costs and identify optimization opportunities.
expected_output: Top savings: right-size instances (30% savings), reserved capacity (20%), unused resources cleanup (15%).

name: competitor_pricing
input: Compare pricing strategies of the top 3 project management tools.
expected_output: Asana starts at $10.99/user, Monday.com at $8/user, Jira at $7.75/user with different feature tiers.

name: performance_review
input: Analyze API response time trends over the last quarter.
expected_output: P50 improved 15% to 120ms, P99 degraded 8% to 890ms, suggesting tail latency issues.

name: json_to_csv
input: [{"product": "Widget A", "price": 29.99}, {"product": "Widget B", "price": 49.99}]
expected_output:
product,price
Widget A,29.99
Widget B,49.99

name: formal_to_casual
input: Transform: 'We regret to inform you that your application has been unsuccessful at this time.'
expected_output: Sorry, your application wasn't successful this time around.

name: sql_to_natural
input: Explain: SELECT u.name, COUNT(o.id) FROM users u JOIN orders o ON u.id = o.user_id GROUP BY u.name HAVING COUNT(o.id) > 5
expected_output: Get user names and their order counts, but only for users with more than 5 orders.

name: markdown_to_html
input:
Convert: # Title
- Item 1
- Item 2
**bold text**
expected_output:
Title

  • Item 1
  • Item 2
bold text

name: units_conversion
input: Convert: Temperature is 72F, distance is 5 miles, weight is 150 lbs.
expected_output: Temperature is 22.2C, distance is 8.05 km, weight is 68.04 kg.

name: intent_detection
input: I'd like to cancel my subscription and get a refund for the remaining months.
expected_output: cancellation_with_refund

name: meeting_notes
input: Action items from today: John to finish API docs by Friday. Sarah to review PRs. Team to present demo next Tuesday.
expected_output: [{"owner": "John", "task": "finish API docs", "deadline": "Friday"}, {"owner": "Sarah", "task": "review PRs"}, {"owner": "Team", "task": "present demo", "deadline": "next Tuesday"}]

name: technical_docs
input: What are the system requirements for installation?
expected_output: Minimum requirements: Python 3.11+, 4GB RAM, 2GB disk space.
context: System Requirements: Python 3.11 or higher. Minimum 4GB RAM. At least 2GB free disk space. Supported OS: Linux, macOS, Windows 10+.

name: error_message
input: Write a user-friendly error message for a 429 rate limit exceeded response.
expected_output: You're making requests too quickly. Please wait a moment and try again.

name: ab_test_analysis
input: Analyze A/B test results: Variant A (1000 users, 5.2% conversion) vs Variant B (1000 users, 6.1% conversion).
expected_output: Variant B shows 17.3% relative improvement. With n=1000 per variant, this is likely statistically significant at p<0.05.
